content:
• Wednesday, November 28, 2012
  • ARO

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) Q3 beats across the board on a slight bump in Y/Y total sales,...

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) Q3 beats across the board on a slight bump in Y/Y total sales, but the shares are down this evening as the apparel retailer forecast its current quarter to come in below Street expectations due to a challenging and inconsistent sales environment. It now sees Q4 earnings of $0.36 to $0.41 per share, compared with analysts expectations of $0.54. Shares -7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM
  • BLOX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BLOX +17.2%. SMTC +7.6%. GES +5.2%. ARQL +4.7%. WDAY...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BLOX +17.2%. SMTC +7.6%. GES +5.2%. ARQL +4.7%. WDAY +3.8%. 
    After-hours top losers: IDIX -14.7%. LZB -13.3%. TKR -10.4%. ARO -7.2%. VECO -7.1%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) says its co-founder, chairman of the board, and CEO, Dennis Pence,...

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) says its co-founder, chairman of the board, and CEO, Dennis Pence, will retire as CEO effective December 31. The board appointed the company's president and chief merchandising officer, Jill Brown Dean, to assume the role of CEO, effective January 1. Shares +3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • GES

    Guess (NYSE:GES) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield...

    Guess (NYSE:GES) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 3.17%. For shareholders of record Dec 12. Payable Dec 28. Ex-div date Dec 10. Additionally, the board declares special dividend of $1.20/share payable with regular dividend. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • LZB

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB) reinstates quarterly dividend of $0.04/share. For shareholders of record Dec...

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB) reinstates quarterly dividend of $0.04/share. For shareholders of record Dec 10. Payable Dec 20. Ex-div date Dec 06. Shares -13.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • BLOX

    Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX): FQ1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $49.5M (+25.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX): FQ1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $49.5M (+25.8% Y/Y) beats by $3.2M. Shares +14% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR): Q3 EPS of -$0.45 beats by $0.30. Revenue of $188.1M (flat% Y/Y)...

    Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR): Q3 EPS of -$0.45 beats by $0.30. Revenue of $188.1M (flat% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • LZB

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ2 EPS of $0.12 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $322.3M (+4.8% Y/Y) misses by...

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ2 EPS of $0.12 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $322.3M (+4.8% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -16.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • RUE

    rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE): Q3 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $225.2M (+15.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE): Q3 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $225.2M (+15.6% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • WDAY

    Workday (NYSE:WDAY): FQ3 EPS of -$0.39 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $72.6M (+99% Y/Y) beats by...

    Workday (NYSE:WDAY): FQ3 EPS of -$0.39 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $72.6M (+99% Y/Y) beats by $8.6M. Expects FQ4 revenue of $75M-$79M, above a $70.5M consensus. Shares +3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • GMAN

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN): Q3 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $143.0M (+8.7% Y/Y)...

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN): Q3 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $143.0M (+8.7% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • NCR

    NCR officially announces it's buying Retalix (NASDAQ:RTLX) for $30/share in cash, or $650M. The...

    NCR officially announces it's buying Retalix (NASDAQ:RTLX) for $30/share in cash, or $650M. The deal is (unsurprisingly, since it's cash-based) expected to be accretive to 2013 earnings, and is seen closing in Q1. NCR claims Retalix's software and services, used in over 70K retail locations, demonstrates its "transformation to a hardware-enabled, software-driven business model." CC at 5:30 PM ET (webcast). NCR and Retalix are halted - the latter soared after news of the deal broke. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • GES

    Guess (NYSE:GES): Q3 EPS of $0.43 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $628.8M (-2% Y/Y) beats by $4M....

    Guess (NYSE:GES): Q3 EPS of $0.43 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $628.8M (-2% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +6.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q3 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $605.9M (+2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q3 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $605.9M (+2% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares -7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • PDCE

    BMO Capital Markets sees "significant upside potential" in PDC Energy (PDCE +6%) given its...

    BMO Capital Markets sees "significant upside potential" in PDC Energy (PDCE +6%) given its Niobrara resource potential and Utica exploration option, even though shares aren't cheap. BMO notes PDC's 103K net acres in the Wattenberg has enough valuation upside to drive share outperformance and PDC has more than enough inventory to focus efforts on it.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • TDC

    Data warehousing plays Teradata (TDC -3.5%) and Informatica (INFA -1.8%) are lower after Amazon...

    Data warehousing plays Teradata (TDC -3.5%) and Informatica (INFA -1.8%) are lower after Amazon Web Services (NASDAQ:AMZN) announces Redshift, a cloud-based service for analyzing giant data sets. AWS' trademark low pricing (less than $1K/TB/year) is included, as is a promise to deliver huge performance gains and handle a variety of management tasks. Though the devil may be in the details, Redshift is bound to unsettle an industry accustomed to 6 and 7-figure deals. Flipboard, NASA, and Netflix are among the early testers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -11.2%) is having an ugly day. The sale of 18K shares by director Dov Bharav...

    Mellanox (MLNX -11.2%) is having an ugly day. The sale of 18K shares by director Dov Bharav (acquired via stock options) could be a factor, though some point to worries about competition from Intel - the chip giant bought QLogic's InfiniBand adapter card/switch business earlier this year, making it a direct rival. Pac Crest and Barclays are defending Mellanox.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • RTLX

    Retalix (RTLX +25.9%) has soared above $27/share on a report from Israel's Calcalist (Google...

    Retalix (RTLX +25.9%) has soared above $27/share on a report from Israel's Calcalist (Google translation) NCR (NCR -0.4%) is buying the company for $30-$31/share. Talks are said to be in the final stages, with a deal expected shortly. Retalix's software offerings for retailers, which include point-of-sale solutions, would complement NCR's point-of-sale hardware.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • ALB

    Shares of Albemarle (ALB +1.6%) move higher today on positive comments out Goldman. The firm...

    Shares of Albemarle (ALB +1.6%) move higher today on positive comments out Goldman. The firm says that the stock overly discounts uncertainties surrounding its Polymer Solutions business. Polymer Solutions represent only 2%-3% of total sales, and weak volumes reflect cyclical economic weakness. ALB should see a strong tailwind as macroeconomic growth recovers. It reiterates a Buy with $67 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +3.2%) and Limelight (LLNW +7.7%) are higher after Piper's Michael Olson upgraded...

    Akamai (AKAM +3.2%) and Limelight (LLNW +7.7%) are higher after Piper's Michael Olson upgraded Akamai to Overweight, while setting a PT of $40. Olson notes high-margin cloud content delivery services are making up a growing share of Akamai's sales, and thinks CDN service prices have stabilized - that last bit is particularly important for Limelight, since it's very dependent on price-sensitive media CDN services. In spite of decent earnings news, Akamai has been range-bound since July.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +16.6%) moves up today after being initiated with a Buy at Deutsche...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +16.6%) moves up today after being initiated with a Buy at Deutsche Bank. The firm says the Street is undervaluing IDIX's new drug pipeline, as investors have been spooked since the FDA put a clinical trials of its lead hepatitis C candidate on hold in August. IDIX recently said study data showed the drug is safe and cured 82% of patients, and the agency's decision on lifting the hold - expected early 2013 - is the key event for the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +6.5%) and Stratasys (SSYS +3.4%) have surged to new highs today without any...

    3D Systems (DDD +6.5%) and Stratasys (SSYS +3.4%) have surged to new highs today without any major news to propel them - 3D announced the European availability of its ProJet 7000 high-end printer and Quickparts on-demand parts service this morning. With 3D and Stratasys respectively having 41.6% and 13.1% of their floats shorted, short squeezes aren't hard to come by. 3D now trades at 31x estimated 2013 EPS, and Stratasys 45.8x. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +6.8%) dazzled analysts with its ability to stay on trend and...

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +6.8%) dazzled analysts with its ability to stay on trend and deliver double-digit same-store sales, but is the read-through to peers warranted? The large number of mall-based retailers outperforming market indexes seem to riding the back of AEO's ability to push all the right buttons instead of any larger sector trend. (earnings, cc).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • UTX

    United Tech's (UTX +1.3%) Sikorsky Aircraft unit says the longer-term outlook for military...

    United Tech's (UTX +1.3%) Sikorsky Aircraft unit says the longer-term outlook for military helicopters remains positive, in spite of potential automatic spending cuts that may pressure the U.S. defense budget. Several new programs - including a U.S. Air Force competition for new search and rescue helicopters and a U.S. Navy competition for new presidential helicopters - will survive, even if the Pentagon is forced to make additional budget cuts.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • RNN

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +9%) trades higher after the company said that Teva Pharmaceutical...

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +9%) trades higher after the company said that Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA -0.6%) will provide an additional $750K in funding to the company. Pursuant to the terms of an earlier agreementl, TEVA will purchase RNN's common stock at 120% of its closing price on the last trading day preceding the closing. TEVA has also agreed to commit additional research funding for development of RX-3117, a potential treatment for solid tumors including colon, lung and pancreatic cancers, and will retain the right to file the Investigational New Drug application with the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • VRML

    Midday top 10 gainers: VRML +34%. SHS +32%. GMCR +24%. SPMD +18%. TROV +17%. GPOR +16%. IDIX...

    Midday top 10 gainers: VRML +34%. SHS +32%. GMCR +24%. SPMD +18%. TROV +17%. GPOR +16%. IDIX +15%. TSL +15%. KCG +14%. AXR +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: UTI -24%. CLUB -21%. OTC:CFNB -16%. GENE -15%. TFM -14%. CBAK-OLD -13%. SBGI -12%. DWCH -13%. NFEC -11%. CAP -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics' (SRPT +2.9%) pops after Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.3%) included...

    Sarepta Therapeutics' (SRPT +2.9%) pops after Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.3%) included comprehensive information about Sarepta's treatment for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy in a slide presentation which was posted online. In the presentation, VRTX describes how SRPT's Eteplirsen, works, noting that the drug has "demonstrated a broadly favorable safety and tolerability profile and restoration of dystrophin protein expression."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.3%) slips on an earlier downgrade to Hold from Buy at Argus. The...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.3%) slips on an earlier downgrade to Hold from Buy at Argus. The firm says VRTX long term outlook looks weak due to potential margin pressures from new entrants in the Hep-C market and an overall slowdown in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • EQU

    Equal Energy (EQU -4.5%) concludes its strategic review process, which the company says has...

    Equal Energy (EQU -4.5%) concludes its strategic review process, which the company says has resulted in $129M in asset sales and a reduction in net debt from $149M to an estimated $23M. EQU also releases details of its 2013 operating and capital budget, which includes estimated cash flow of $33M and a $36M capex budget.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • NYMX

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +3.4%) says it's completed the patient enrollment process for its...

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +3.4%) says it's completed the patient enrollment process for its Phase III trial of NX-1207 for BPH. Top-line results are expected in late 2013, and include pivotal studies in the U.S. and Europe, re-injection studies in the U.S., prostate cancer trials, as well as other clinical and non-clinical research activities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • YGE

    A relief rally or a dead-cat bounce? Depressed Chinese solar stocks are up after Yingli (YGE...

    A relief rally or a dead-cat bounce? Depressed Chinese solar stocks are up after Yingli (YGE +11.2%) and JA Solar (JASO +6.8%) delivered better-than-feared results (I, II) and guidance. Trina (TSL +12.9%), LDK Solar (LDK +6.2%), and misnamed Canadian Solar (CSIQ +5.9%) are among the winners. A Reuters column today notes Chinese vendors are increasingly counting on domestic sales (boosted by subsidies) to drive growth, as they cope with anti-dumping tariffs in the U.S. and perhaps soon Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • KCG

    Virtu is reportedly making a $3/share all-cash bid for Knight Capital, according to Charlie...

    Virtu is reportedly making a $3/share all-cash bid for Knight Capital, according to Charlie Gasparino. On the surface, it's well less than than Getco's $3.50 bid, but Getco's deal is more a merger with part of the value being stock in the combined company - and who knows what that will be worth. KCG +11.5% to $3.31.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • SBUX

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -2.5%) dip after short selling firm Glaucus hammers the company again in...

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -2.5%) dip after short selling firm Glaucus hammers the company again in a new report. The firm still claims Teavana duped Starbucks and the pending deal could fall apart.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • AKS

    Also providing a spark behind the move in AK Steel (AKS +3%) is Chairman and CEO James...

    Also providing a spark behind the move in AKSteel (AKS +3%) is Chairman and CEO James Wainscott's purchase yesterday of 100K shares at $3.845 each. Wainscott now owns ~684K AKS shares. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • BP

    BP's (BP -1.4%) suspension from new U.S. government contracts due to the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil...

    BP's (BP -1.4%) suspension from new U.S. government contracts due to the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill, though temporary, could have wide implications for its U.S. operations. The move could lead to the cancellation of lucrative fuel contracts BP gets from the Department of Defense and complicate BP's efforts to acquire new leases to drill on federal lands or waters.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 10 Comments
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE +7.7%) jumps this morning after Aegis Capital initiated the shares with a...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE +7.7%) jumps this morning after Aegis Capital initiated the shares with a Buy and a $6.00 price target. Aegis says that GALE has developed a novel approach to combating the recurrence of breast cancer in patients with minimal residual disease. The firm's lead candidate, NeuVax, is a peptide vaccine derived from a protein that is the target of several widely used breast cancer treatments. It's currently conducting Phase III trials and is slated to report interim data in late 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P -3.3%) is trading lower as CEO Joe Kennedy gets ready to testify before Congress in...

    Pandora (P -3.3%) is trading lower as CEO Joe Kennedy gets ready to testify before Congress in favor of the Internet Radio Fairness Act, which would bring the royalty rate paid by Pandora in line with what's paid by satellite radio firms. "The current rate-setting structure is a clear case of discrimination against the Internet," Kennedy states in prepared testimony. Needless to say, the music industry feels differently. SA's Stephen Faulkner doubts the Act will pass, given the differences between Internet and satellite radio's business models.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • AMZN

    Shares of Whole Foods Market (WFM -1.9%) and Hain Celestial Group (HAIN -1.5%) can't get out of...

    Shares of Whole Foods Market (WFM -1.9%) and Hain Celestial Group (HAIN -1.5%) can't get out of the way of a disappointing report from peer The Fresh Market that's cutting a wide swath. While profits and revenue are still growing briskly, valuations on the health food sector don't give much margin for error.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 16 Comments
  • ENVI

    Envivio (ENVI +12.3%) is getting a much-needed rally after announcing its encoding software has...

    Envivio (ENVI +12.3%) is getting a much-needed rally after announcing its encoding software has been deployed by LG's service provider arm to help power a Google TV-based (NASDAQ:GOOG) video service in South Korea. But shares still remain down 80% from an IPO price of $9, thanks to a torrent of bad earnings news. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • COST

    Costco (COST +4.4%) moves higher after announcing a special dividend and releasing same-store...

    Costco (COST +4.4%) moves higher after announcing a special dividend and releasing same-store sales growth numbers that still sail north of those of Wal-Mart and Target. Analysts are also more than a little bit intrigued with the prospect of ConAgra helping Costco increase the volume of private label products after execs tipped off the increasing focus on the partnership on a conference call yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +14%) soars after reporting test results on its Shugert 1-12H well in the...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +14%) soars after reporting test results on its Shugert 1-12H well in the Utica Shale, anticipating it will begin flowing the well into a sales pipeline by the end of January. GPOR also announces its first sales through MarkWest's (NYSE:MWE) Harrison County gas processing complex.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 5 Comments
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +3.3%) trade higher after CNBC reports Black Friday sales were strong...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +3.3%) trade higher after CNBC reports Black Friday sales were strong at the retailer. Is this the type of knee-jerk stock move that Barry Ritholtz is vociferously warning about being a media fantasy?
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 4 Comments
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +1.5%) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at Dahlman Rose, which believes the...

    AKSteel (AKS +1.5%) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at Dahlman Rose, which believes the implications of recent debt and equity issues have been priced in and near-term liquidity risk has been removed. Though the firm remains neutral on the steel sector, it favors service centers on a relative basis.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • AKG

    Keegan Resources (KGN -2.8%) reaches an out-of-court settlement of the Esaase gold concession...

    Keegan Resources (KGN -2.8%) reaches an out-of-court settlement of the Esaase gold concession lawsuit which had alleged irregularities in the execution of a 2007 agreement by which KGN obtained title to the concessions. KGN says financial details are confidential, but the settlement amount wasn’t material to the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • GENE

    Genetic Tech (NASDAQ:GENE) plunges 20% following a management earthquake at its annual meeting....

    Genetic Tech (NASDAQ:GENE) plunges 20% following a management earthquake at its annual meeting. The trouble started when Genetic founder Mervyn Jacobson used his 29% stake to block the re-election of chairman Mel Bridges, with a motion to re-elect fellow director Huw Jones also failing. CEO Paul MacLeman then resigned, as did director Greg Brown and legal head David Sparling.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) -3.5% after disclosing it has received a grand jury subpoena from a U.S....

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) -3.5% after disclosing it has received a grand jury subpoena from a U.S. district court related to federal government contracts. The contracts include a $19M deal from a reseller that involved Riverbed products and services.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • SLV

    If it's a fat finger, it's not immediately being lifted. So far, gold hasn't bounced a dime from...

    If it's a fat finger, it's not immediately being lifted. So far, gold hasn't bounced a dime from a quick $20 sell-off an hour ago. Chatter says the move was due to a contract rollover that accidentally became an outright sell. Silver has moved in concert, SLV -2.1% premarket. Oil and copper, both lower by more than 1%, complete the picture for key commodities.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 20 Comments
  • TFM

    Shares of The Fresh Market (NASDAQ:TFM) dive 15.5% premarket with the company missing the...

    Shares of The Fresh Market (NASDAQ:TFM) dive 15.5% premarket with the company missing the estimate of analysts with its Q3 report and seeing its CFO resign. Just to top it off, Deutsche Bank cuts the company to Hold from Buy with a clipped price target of $54.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Global shares are taking a dive as Washington continues the agonizing over the fiscal cliff,...

    Global shares are taking a dive as Washington continues the agonizing over the fiscal cliff, with S&P futures -0.3%. Surely investors know by now the way its likely to play out - nothing will be agreed until the very last minute, after which shares will enjoy a relief rally. Back in the corporate world, Green Mountain (+21%) gets back to winning ways in its latest earnings, while Knight Capital jumps 19% following a bid from Getco. Later: New home sales. Fed's Beige Book
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Premarket gainers: GMCR +20%. KCG +19%. EXPR +11%. AEO +6%. PPHM +5%. Losers: TFM -15%. GWRE...

    Premarket gainers: GMCR +20%. KCG +19%. EXPR +11%. AEO +6%. PPHM +5%. Losers: TFM -15%. GWRE -13%. NBG -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • AMSC

    American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) -15.9% to new multi-year lows after: 1) Stating it expects...

    American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) -15.9% to new multi-year lows after: 1) Stating it expects FQ3 revenue of $20M+ and EPS above -$0.46, which suggests it will soundly miss a consensus of $26.5M and -$0.24. The company blames financing and cash flow constraints among wind farm builders and turbine manufacturers. 2) Announcing it has cut its workforce by 25% and is consolidating office space. It expects these moves to cut annual expenses by $10M, and produce charges of $3M-$4M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • BP

    BP -2.1% premarket after the EPA announces the company has been temporarily suspended from new...

    BP -2.1% premarket after the EPA announces the company has been temporarily suspended from new contracts with the U.S. government.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 8 Comments
  • ARO

    Mall-based retailers are on watch after Express and American Eagle Outfitters delivered Q3...

    Mall-based retailers are on watch after Express and American Eagle Outfitters delivered Q3 numbers and Q4 guidance solid enough to infuse confidence in traders. Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO), +3.5% premarket, is an early riser in what could set up to be a retail rush.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM

  • Flash crash in gold? The yellow metal dives $20 in the space of a few trades, now -1.6% to...

    Flash crash in gold? The yellow metal dives $20 in the space of a few trades, now -1.6% to $1,716/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 17 Comments
  • AEO

    More on American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) Q3: Comparable store sales up 10%, inclusive of a...

    More on American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) Q3: Comparable store sales up 10%, inclusive of a 27% gain in online sales. Capital expenditures fell to $23M during the period from $30M a year ago. The retailer expects EPS in Q4 to fall in a range of $0.54 to $0.56 and FY12 EPS of $1.38-$1.40, both estimates a minor bump from prior guidance. AEO +6.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • ANN

    More on Ann's (NYSE:ANN) Q3: Ann Taylor and Loft brands both saw positive same store sales...

    More on Ann's (NYSE:ANN) Q3: Ann Taylor and Loft brands both saw positive same store sales growth during the quarter, 4.3% and 6.2% respectively. On a percentage of sales comparison, SG&A expenses improved 90 bps to 46.9%. Sees FY12 revenue of $2.4B, in-line with consensus. ANN +1.0% premarket. (PR)
